alert.note: Alert for Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:27PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL MCKINLEY AND SOUTH CENTRAL SAN JUAN COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM MDT... At 426 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Standing Rock, or 15 miles northwest of Crownpoint, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Standing Rock, Mariano Lake, Naschitti and Brimhall Nizhoni. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains
